title: Requirements Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Once your application gets picked up by HR you get screened by them then passed onto the hiring manager. They say that the hiring manager must contact you within 7 days. This didn't happen with either job that I applied for. The first one they at least did follow up, and the second one instead of any contact they just changed my application to "no longer being considered" and I guess decided they'd never follow up again - even though I was qualified for the position.

Everyone that I spoke to for the Requirements Analyst position was very cordial, but they misrepresented the position in the job description. It wasn't an agile position, it was a Business Analyst position, even though they didn't name it as such. Even with several proceeding interviews before the technical one I never understood that from them. So I got into my final interview and was bombarded with technical questions that I had no way of answering because I had no background as a Business Analyst. My experience is as an Agile Product Owner and Scrum Master.

After that horrible interview, I expected to never hear from them again. Funny enough they called me and offered me the position as a regular Analyst instead of Senior. They knew my pay requirements and decided to offer me $25,000 less than I asked for, which would mean a significant pay cut from what I'm even currently making.

I wanted to hold off on leaving this review to see if it was a fluke, but then I got ghosted again for a Scrum Master position (one that I am much more qualified for) and didn't hear back from the recruiter until I followed up myself. I was then informed they decided to hire internally.
Interview Questions: Many technical questions about Business Analyst topics (asking me more or less to define terms).

title: Marketing Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Spectrum Health
Interview Descriptions:
The whole process lasted for about three months. I applied online, had a phone interview where I was told I was being moved on to the hiring manager and would be contacted in a week or so for scheduling an in-person interview. It ended up being about 5 weeks later (I did follow up with HR during that time) and was told the position was being put on hold. Took another 5-6 weeks until I heard back and was told they were starting up the process again. Took another week before I was contacted for an interview. Had an in-person interview where I met with the hiring manager followed up by the team of people that the position would be working with. Then it took another two weeks to hear the results where I was told that the position had been filled. A few weeks later, the same position was re-posted and the job description was changed. 

Spectrum Health has been high on my list of future employers for a long time, but after this whole experience, I will reconsider ever applying for them again. I understand that things change and departments have to restructure, but it might be a good idea to not post a position until you are definitely ready to interview and hire someone. And what was even more frustrating to me was that the position was cancelled and then got re-posted asking for someone with fewer years of experience. I had to take a whole day of PTO off of work for the interview due to the time that was available, only to later find out the position was cancelled. Please consider the fact that it costs people time and money to interview, not to mention the fact that it makes the company look bad when the hiring department isn't actually ready to hire or don't know what they want in a future person.
Interview Questions: Why was I interested in the position? Why did I want to work for Spectrum Health? Why am I looking for a new position at this time? And a variety of behavior type questions.

title: Information Security Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI)
Interview Descriptions:
External is a much longer process.  Internal candidates will be interviewed by a couple of team members for fit and function. Typically, everyone knows each other already so these are more or less an extension of a conversation that already started prior to the internal position being posted. In other words, the hiring manager will usually have someone in mind. 

External is always done through HR - there is a vetting process and typically a short interview with the HR resources to ensure you meet the minimal qualifications. At this point your resume will be forwarded on to the hiring manager who will then float it to their senior people for response. In some instances the hiring manager will reach out for a phone call but most often this is delegated to members of the team. Sometimes this will be conversational but it could also be the dreaded behavioral analysis interview - 'tell us about a time where you failed at something'...... blah blah blah. This is painful for everyone involved so just know that it is an HR requirement. We didn't choose to go that route. 

Once you make it past the behavioral then there will be a broader interview with other members of the team. Questions will be focused on your fit for the role and also for your interactions with other members of the team. In short, you need to know your stuff and fit with the culture of the team. You may be asked to come in a couple of times and you should know ahead of time that this process drags on much longer than it should. 

If you make it past those rounds then HR will authorize the hiring manager to make an offer. Again, this usually takes longer than it should so you might have to wait awhile. Once the offer is made and accepted then you work with HR to finalize the details - start date, drug testing, background check, orientation, etc.......
Interview Questions: In the technical interview I was presented with a network diagram and asked to walk through it - describe the flow of data, the roles of various pieces if equipment and a determination of how it might be improved upon for a set of given circumstances

Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: They do not offer competitive wages.  The pay scale for the Patient Service Representative's are higher than Medical Assistants.  Patient Service Representative's only require a high school diploma, where a Medical Assistant is required to be certified or registered, submit continuing education credits, and pay dues yearly in order to stay registered or certified.  This is completely unfair.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with a recruiter who came to my school, and she encouraged me to apply for a couple positions online. I had a phone interview with HR, and then interviewed in person with my would-be manger. It took them about a month between my phone interview to set up my in person interview.
Interview Questions: Explain your previous experience.

title: Process Improvement Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Unprofessional and unprepared. Set up phone interview with me. I took off work at my current job to make the interview time. Upon calling, discovered my start date was later than she thought (even though it said on my app when I could start). Had to hang up with me and call someone else to see if that start date would work. Called me back hours later saying they needed someone sooner. Complete waste of my time.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking for a new career opportunity?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spectrum Health in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: First you go through a phone interview, then if you pass you will get an in-person interview. Standard questions at an interview and heard within a day if I got the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty easy and It took about 15-20 minutes. The first interview was on phone with HR and after a couple of weeks, I was called for the 1-1 interview with the Unit Manager.
Interview Questions: Explain the situation where you get along with a disagreement between a patient or the family member?

title: Rehab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was great. The lady who interviewed me was very friendly and showed me around. I never been to that hospital before, so it was very nice of her to show me around the place.
Interview Questions: Do I plan to go to school and go higher up in the company?

title: Medical Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was called in with the hiring supervisor and director. All of my background education and job experience was discussed to see how much knowledge and training I had in the job position. I was familiar with the supervisor, director, and position so they were very helpful and professional.
Interview Questions: If I currently did the job duties at my prior position as it was a transfer to a different job at a different clinic.

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Spectrum Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was called the next day for a phone interview and to set up a face to face interview the next day. scheduled the interview and was hired a few hours later. Interview was easy and straight forward. Interviewer was nice and comforting. I didn't feel intimidated at all.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What are your hobbies? What type of experience do you have in this position? Are you in school?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Offers job shadow experience, job description thoroughly explained, asked questions regarding long term relationship with company and goals, asked about education, work experience, why I'm a good fit for spectrum health
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in ten years?

title: Nursing Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this job in April of 2014, but was never contacted, so I figured they didn't even consider me for the position. Out of the blue though, in July of 2014 HR emailed me and asked if I would be available to do a phone interview. I gave her a time and she called me the next day. It literally took about 15-20 minutes, which was short from previous phone interviews I have done. She emailed me a few days later and recommended me to the head nurse in the dempartment the position was for. The head nurse emailed me and I believe we talked on the phone to set up an in person interview. The face to face interview literally took only 20 minutes, which did make me nervous. Other than that though it seemed to go extremely well. The basic interview questions were asked. Be prepared to be asked what your long term goals are and where you see yourself in 5 or 10 years. Have your answers ready before the interview. You want to come off as confident. Then, 5 days later(due to the holiday and what not) HR called me and offered me the position. I am ecstatic!
Interview Questions: When was a time where you made a mistake? And how did you fix it?

title: Mobile/Web Developer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter and set up a phone screen.  The initial phone screen was pretty straight forward and asked about my background, interests, future plans, etc.  After the phone screen I was contacted within a few days to setup an in-person interview.  This first in-person interview was to test my technical background.  They asked some basic JavaScript questions and also some logic questions.  Nothing too difficult.  After that, I was contacted once more to set-up a final in-person interview which was more of a job shadow.  This was an all-day meet and greet with the different project teams.  Everyone was nice and asked me questions about myself and also gave me opportunities to ask about their work.
Interview Questions: How many gas stations are there in Grand Rapids?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Spectrum Health
Interview Descriptions: Clunky, so many people was emailing me and it was confusing who to contact about benefits and stuff. Said one thing in the interview that still has not panned out (strategic organization, value people who are vocal)
Interview Questions: Nothing earth shatteringly different than other interviews

title: Medical Informatics Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Spectrum Health in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a 30mins phone interview for a data analyst/mining position. Other than the mentioned questions, I was given detailed project overview. I liked the project in one go and thus decided to immediately accept the offer.
Interview Questions: What have you done as part of your masters' degree?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I had my leadership rotation on the same unit I was hired.  I applied through the nurse recruiter, was given an interview with her, followed by an interview with the unit managers.  The process was straightforward, and all communications followed through the nurse recruiter.  This was more than 10 years ago.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses, and how do you think that you can overcome it?

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lots of questions on my experience, sales , customer service, medical questions, ect, phone call, in person interview, training, skills questions, computer questions, how I would deal with trauma, ER, ect
Interview Questions: how good I was with customer service and how I had healthcare experience

title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spectrum Health
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is what you would expect.  A long HR process followed by multiple interviews and weeks of waiting for an answer.  This is not a a slam:  this is the typical employer-employee process you will find in most organizations of this size.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness and describe a time that you were able to solve a problem effectively.

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online, received phone in two to three weeks. I recieved a face to face interview shortly after.
Very friendly and felt very comfortable. 
Two people interviewed and me and took turns asking me questions. Asked me a lot of scenario questions.
Interview Questions: What does culturally competency mean to you?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: One phone screen interview that was very easy and provided me quality feedback for about 10-15 min followed by one in person interview with a manager and a member of the team that took about 30 min. I was given a minute to think about answers before giving them which helped a lot.
Interview Questions: Define customer service.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health in Sept 2013

After some time I was scheduled for an in-person interview which was a group-interview style with multiple current employees asking me questions. This was more specific to PT critical thinking skills. I did not get the specific job I was interviewing for, but I was called a few weeks later regarding another position that was open.
Interview Questions: Have you had a situation where a patient was upset and not able to participate in therapy? If so what did you do to try to help the patient?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview, followed by 2 more interviews. One with management, the other with peers. The phone interview was with a talent recruiter and asked some tough questions. The managers asked a few customary questions and the rest of the interview was very relaxed. The peer interview was more intense with more standard questions. It was a positive experience and I truly felt they were looking for the best candidate, not just with experience but also personally.
Interview Questions: What could I offer or contribute to the organization?

title: Patient Registration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Received a call that same week from HR. Then a recruiter for a phone interview about 30 mins. Then received a call from a manager for a brief group interview, with the patient registration managers of different department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you failed?

title: Applications Development Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Feb 2013

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Leadership Interview

It turned out to be a little far from my home town, so I decided not to continue the process of seeking a job with them.
Interview Questions: No real unexpected questions.

title: Material Handler Interview

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Mar 2012

title: New Grad Float Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Mar 2012

The references were asked to complete a questionaire which rated different characteristics. It also asked them to give 3 strenghts and 3 weakeness of myself. Now I"m just waiting for the interview.

title: Patient Registration Specialist Interview

This interview will be even more in detail about you past and what you can offer our team.

title: Registered Dietitian Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spectrum Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Sept 2010

title: Medsurg/Labor and Delivery Staff RN Interview

title: Medical Office Specialist Interview
